intro: Bicornella hanningtonii, commonly known as the Hannington's bicorn, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or clay soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
